name: Cinnamon Roll Muffins
author: Louise Buckles
summary: Muffins that taste just like cinnamon rolls.
ingredients: ¼ cup unsalted butter, melted and cooled
1 teaspoon milk, or more as needed
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line 18 muffin cups with paper liners
Combine raisins and water in a small saucepan; bring to a boil
Turn off the heat and let sit for 10 minutes
Stir flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt together in a large bowl
Make a well in the center
Stir melted butter into the raisin-water mixture, then add eggs and mix until well beaten
Pour into the well in the flour mixture; mix quickly and lightly with a fork until moistened and lumpy; do not beat
Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups
Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about 25 minutes
Cool in the tins for 5 minutes
Transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely, about 20 minutes
Meanwhile, combine powdered sugar and vanilla for glaze in a bowl
Stir in 1 teaspoon milk, adding more if necessary, until thin enough to drizzle
